intro: Crabbea hirsuta var. somalensis, commonly known as the Somali hairy cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Somalia and surrounding regions. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. This variant is noted for its resilience and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
